title: text from old (30's - 40's - 50's ???) Italian bar logo
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020213342im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bar%20napoli%20cecina_6319.jpg)

Hi all,

I'm breaking my head over this font. I want to determine the "Napoli" and "dal 1932" part. Probably the same ;).

Thanks in advance!

Lucas
author: Elvee

comments.content:
this one's a bit bigger, but don't be surprised if it's hand lettered.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020213342im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Bar_Napoli_6673.jpg)
If it is hand lettered, what would be the best alternative then?
i'm not saying what it is or isn't. and honestly, one of my more esteemed colleagues will have a much better answer than i. some of the folks here are very educated about older types :)

Almost certainly hand-lettered. This is similar, but perhaps not cigar-worthy...

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/moonshine-script-nf/moonshine-sc...](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020213342/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/moonshine-script-nf/moonshine-script-nf/glyphs.html "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/moonshine-script-nf/moonshine-script-nf/glyphs.html")

Hand lettered. For example look at the two versions of a.  
As for the best alternative, I think that is for you to decide based on what you see.  
Here is a little collection fonts -- some very common, others probably unfamiliar -- that have various aspects of the lettering style:  
BrushScript:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020213342im_/http:/typophile.com/files/BrushScript_6033.jpg)
  
CascadeScriptLT:  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020213342im_/http:/typophile.com/files/CascadeScriptLT_4757.jpg)
  
ForelleMN:  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020213342im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ForelleMN_3429.jpg)
  
FreestyleScriptLET:  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020213342im_/http:/typophile.com/files/FreestyleScriptLET_6445.jpg)
  
Impregnable:  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020213342im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Impregnable_4443.jpg)
  
Kaufmann:  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020213342im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Kaufmann_5536.jpg)
  
LHFSamsterScript  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020213342im_/http:/typophile.com/files/LHFSamsterScript_6097.jpg)
  
MarketingScript:  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020213342im_/http:/typophile.com/files/MarketingScript%5BFontShop)
\_3545.jpg]  
PendryScriptEF:  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020213342im_/http:/typophile.com/files/PendryScriptEF_5903.jpg)
  
RondoMN:  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020213342im_/http:/typophile.com/files/RondoMN_5074.jpg)
  
ScriptMTBold:  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020213342im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ScriptMTBold_4133.jpg)
  
Enjoy.  
Don
